title: Nigerian Singers Win Big at African Music Awards
summary: Nigerian singers won many prizes at the All Africa Music Awards in Lagos. Burna Boy got Album of the Year for his new album. He also won Best African Collaboration with Shallipopi, who won Song of the Year for his popular song Laho. Rema won three awards, including Artiste of the Year. Other Nigerian winners included Yemi Alade and Phyno. New singers like Qing Madi and Chella also won awards. While Nigeria did very well, singers from other African countries like Senegal, Algeria, Ghana, South Africa, and Tanzania won awards too. The awards show how popular Afrobeats music is around the world.

background_read: The All Africa Music Awards is a big event that celebrates the best music from Africa. It happens every year and gives prizes to singers and musicians. Nigeria is a country in West Africa known for its popular music, especially Afrobeats. This type of music has become famous all over the world. The awards show how talented African artists are and help people learn about new music.

WHAT: They won many awards at the All Africa Music Awards in Lagos.
WHERE: The awards ceremony was held in Lagos, Nigeria.
WHY: To celebrate African music talent and show the global popularity of Afrobeats.
